data.e: DOM stands for Document Object Model, which represents the HTML document as a tree of objects.

data.q: Which method is commonly used to select an element by its ID?
data.e: document.getElementById() selects a single element with the specified ID.

data.q: Which method allows selecting the first element matching a CSS selector?
data.e: querySelector() returns the first element that matches the given CSS selector.

o: Attaches an event handler to an element
data.e: addEventListener() attaches an event handler without overwriting existing handlers.

data.q: Which event is triggered when a user clicks on an element?
data.e: The click event fires when a pointing device button is pressed and released on an element.

o: Cancels all events on the page
data.e: preventDefault() stops the browserâ€™s default behavior, such as form submission or link navigation.

o: Events moving from parent to child
Events moving from child to parent
data.e: Event bubbling means an event propagates from the target element up through its ancestors.

data.q: Which property refers to the element that triggered the event?
data.e: event.target refers to the actual element on which the event occurred.

data.q: Which method removes an existing event listener?
data.e: removeEventListener() removes a previously added event listener.

data.q: Which DOM property is used to change the text inside an element?
data.e: innerHTML, innerText, and textContent can all change displayed text, with different behaviors and use cases.
